page.title: 18HINTON MILL FARM.
page.content: This farm is held by the{Long family as tenants of the{Glynn estate. It is{mainly dairy,}with 100 acres to pasture and 16 acres of fodder crops. There are a herd of 106 Freisians, 56 in milk and 50 followers. In addition they hold 6 pet sheep, 2 ponies, 2 dogs and 30 bantams.{Machinery used includes 3 tractors plus accessories. Buildings include 1 covered yard, 1 breast parlour ( 3 standing, 3 milking ), a{domesday mill}(disused) house and calf sheds. Previous tenants were Buddens, Seeviours, Keevals who farmed there for over 100 years. The land has been farmed for at least 500 years in association with the mill. The Longs now hold some of the land freehold and also rent grazing from Hinton Moor. It is a{family farm}with the accent as much on life_style as profit.
